news_header: Harvey Weinstein, imprisoned for sexual assault, has been diagnosed with myeloma while serving a 16-year sentence.
news_text: Former film producer Harvey Weinstein, currently serving a 16-year prison sentence for sexual assault, has been diagnosed with myeloma, a type of blood and bone marrow cancer. He is receiving treatment at Rikers prison in New York. Reports indicate that the average life expectancy for myeloma patients under 65 is about seven years, while Weinstein is 72 years old. He continues to face ongoing trials related to criminal offenses stemming from a case that emerged in 2017.
